TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit OperatingSystemOperationsExtensions extends System.Object

Docs.summary: The Service Management API provides programmatic access to much of the functionality available through the Management Portal. The Service Management API is a REST API. All API operations are performed over SSL, and are mutually authenticated using X.509 v3 certificates. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/ee460799.aspx for more information)

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Compute.Models.OperatingSystemListResponse List(class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Compute.IOperatingSystemOperations operations) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function List (operations As IOperatingSystemOperations) As OperatingSystemListResponse

Docs.summary: The List Operating Systems operation lists the versions of the guest operating system that are currently available in Windows Azure. The 2010-10-28 version of List Operating Systems also indicates what family an operating system version belongs to. Currently Azure supports two operating system families: the Azure guest operating system that is substantially compatible with Windows Server 2008 SP2, and the Azure guest operating system that is substantially compatible with Windows Server 2008 R2. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/ff684168.aspx for more information)
Docs.returns: The List Operating Systems operation response.

Docs.summary: The List Operating Systems operation lists the versions of the guest operating system that are currently available in Windows Azure. The 2010-10-28 version of List Operating Systems also indicates what family an operating system version belongs to. Currently Azure supports two operating system families: the Azure guest operating system that is substantially compatible with Windows Server 2008 SP2, and the Azure guest operating system that is substantially compatible with Windows Server 2008 R2. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/ff684168.aspx for more information)
Docs.returns: The List Operating Systems operation response.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Compute.Models.OperatingSystemListFamiliesResponse ListFamilies(class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Compute.IOperatingSystemOperations operations) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function ListFamilies (operations As IOperatingSystemOperations) As OperatingSystemListFamiliesResponse

Docs.summary: The List OS Families operation lists the guest operating system families available in Azure, and also lists the operating system versions available for each family. Currently Azure supports two operating system families: the Azure guest operating system that is substantially compatible with Windows Server 2008 SP2, and the Azure guest operating system that is substantially compatible with Windows Server 2008 R2. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/gg441291.aspx for more information)
Docs.returns: The List Operating System Families operation response.

<Extension()> Public Function ListFamiliesAsync (operations As IOperatingSystemOperations) As Task(Of OperatingSystemListFamiliesResponse)

Docs.summary: The List OS Families operation lists the guest operating system families available in Azure, and also lists the operating system versions available for each family. Currently Azure supports two operating system families: the Azure guest operating system that is substantially compatible with Windows Server 2008 SP2, and the Azure guest operating system that is substantially compatible with Windows Server 2008 R2. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/gg441291.aspx for more information)
Docs.returns: The List Operating System Families operation response.
